snippet: RSA also said it needed additional reserves for its Irish operations, which faces an accounting investigation.
abstract: Simon Lee, chief executive of British Insurer RSA Group, steps down after company says for second time in month that it would have to significantly increase reserves for its Irish business and for third time in six weeks warns of lower profits.
lead_paragraph: RSA also said it needed additional reserves for its Irish operations, which faces an accounting investigation.

headline.main: Chief at British Insurer Quits after 3rd Profit Warning
headline.print_headline: Chief Executive of British Insurer to Depart
